summary: This document is a chain of emails from August to November 2020 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) from the Southern District of New York, attorney Gloria Allred, and attorney Wang. The emails primarily concern scheduling calls and interviews for potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and an update from the FBI regarding photographs of the victims.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Prominent attorney from Allred, Maroko & Goldberg, co-counsel with Wang, representing potential victims of Epstein and Maxwell. She is coordinating with the AUSA to schedule client interviews and discuss case updates.

persons.name: Wang
persons.context: Attorney (likely from Cuti Hecker Wang LLP) acting as co-counsel with Gloria Allred, corresponding with the AUSA to schedule victim interviews and request information from the FBI.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: An unnamed Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York, communicating with victims' attorneys about scheduling interviews and providing updates from the FBI investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender; the central figure in the case whose victims are being interviewed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Epstein's associate, mentioned in the context of victims' interactions with her and as a subject of the investigation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the summary of one victim's allegations, involving a final interaction with Epstein at a townhouse in 2010.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred, who sent a Zoom conference link for a scheduled call.

connections.description: Co-counsel representing potential victims of Epstein and Maxwell, coordinating closely on scheduling and communications with the AUSA.
Attorney communicating with federal prosecutor to schedule victim interviews and receive investigative updates.
Attorney corresponding directly with the federal prosecutor regarding case logistics and information requests.
Mentioned together as the perpetrators against whom the potential victims are making allegations.
Prince Andrew is mentioned in the context of a victim's final interaction with Epstein at a townhouse in 2010.
Diane Aldrich is identified as the Executive Assistant to Gloria Allred.

events.title: Scheduled Zoom call with AUSA
events.description: A Zoom call was scheduled between attorneys Gloria Allred, Wang, and the AUSA to discuss potential victims of Epstein and Maxwell prior to scheduling interviews.

events.title: Potential victim interviews
events.description: A date was discussed for the AUSA's team to interview clients whose meetings had been adjourned a few weeks prior.

events.title: Call to convey FBI photo update
events.description: A call was scheduled for the AUSA to provide an update received from the FBI regarding photographs of the attorneys' clients (victims).

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Attorneys Gloria Allred and Wang were representing multiple potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell and coordinating their interviews with the U.S. Attorney's Office in late 2020.
The FBI was involved in the investigation, specifically regarding providing information about photographs of the victims to the AUSA.

Victim allegations summarized in the emails span from 2000 to 2017 and include incidents in New York, Florida, Paris, California, and Washington, DC, with some involving interactions with Ghislaine Maxwell and other associates of Epstein.
One specific allegation mentions a victim's final interaction with Epstein in 2010 included an interaction with Prince Andrew at a townhouse.

The correspondence shows ongoing coordination and sensitivity in handling victim communications, with attorneys waiting for clarification from the FBI before conveying potentially difficult information to their clients.
